traits.role_among_twelve: one of the Twelve who hands Jesus over to the authorities.
traits.betrayal_motive: approaches chief priests to betray Jesus; motive not fully explained.

traits.role_among_twelve: one of the Twelve who betrays Jesus for money.
traits.betrayal_motive: accepts thirty pieces of silver from chief priests.
traits.death_account: returns the money in remorse and hangs himself; field of blood story linked to priests' use of money.

traits.role_among_twelve: one of the Twelve who leads authorities to Jesus.
traits.betrayal_motive: Satan enters Judas; he discusses terms with chief priests and officers.
traits.death_account: not described in the Gospel; Acts provides a different version.

traits.role_among_twelve: one of the disciples, identified as the betrayer at the meal.
traits.betrayal_motive: depicted as keeper of the money box and called a thief; Satan enters him at the meal.
traits.death_account: not narrated; focus is on his departure into the night.

traits.role_among_twelve: former member of the apostolic circle whose place must be filled.
traits.betrayal_motive: described in relation to wickedness and acquisition of the field.
traits.death_account: falls headlong and bursts open in the field, with the place called Akeldama (Field of Blood).
